intro: Conceveiba santanderensis, commonly known as the Santanderian Conceveiba, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
